title: How to Set Up Additional Menus with Time Slots
transcript: Fourth additional menu. Welcome back. In this tutorial, we will walk you through setting up additional menus in the Food Chow admin panel. This feature helps you organize your menu based on meal types, such as breakfast, lunch, or dinner, and allows you to set custom availability times. Let's get started. First, go to setup and select additional menu from the Food Chow admin panel. Here you'll see a list of all existing menus along with options to edit, delete, or add a new menu. To create a new menu, click on add menu. Enter the menu name. This is a required field. Then set the menu availability time, such as lunch hours from 12:00 PM to 3:00 PM or dinner from 7:00 PM to 11:00 PM. If you want the menu to be available all day, select 24 hours. You can also use Apply to All to set the same schedule for every day, or select close to disable it on specific days. Click next to Move to Item Selection. Here, choose the items you want to include in this menu. You can also customize prices and set item variance if needed. Once you finalize your selections, click save to complete the menu setup. To display the menu in the system, select it as the active menu in the menu section. Then to ensure that the changes reflect in online orders, go to Sync menu, select the updated menu, and confirm the sink. That's it. You have successfully created and customized an additional menu in the Food Chow admin panel. Now, your restaurant can offer meal specific menus with controlled availability, making it easier to manage and enhance the customer experience. Thanks for watching and happy managing with Food Chow.

title: How to Configure Order Settings
transcript: Fifth order setting. Welcome back. In this guide, we will walk you through the ordering settings in Food Chow and how to customize them for a smooth ordering experience. For example, if a customer selects takeaway, a predefined charge will be automatically added to their order. Next, we have email notifications. Enable the first option to send an email notification to the restaurant when an order is placed. Enable the second option to send an order confirmation email to the customer. These settings are the same for all order types, but for dine-in orders, there's an extra setting for QR code ordering. This allows customers to scan a QR code and place their order directly from their table. Another important setting is customer details. If the checkbox is marked, customers must enter their details before placing an order, ensuring complete information for smoother processing. And that's it. You now know how to configure your ordering settings in Food Chow for a seamless customer experience. Thanks for watching and happy managing with Food Chow.
